*Sigh* Thats about all I'm going to say about this series. Huge disappointment. It could have been done in a decent way similar to Ouran High School. It actually could have been a great series if they changed pretty much everything, but kept the premise.

This is a Reverse Harem, and it is a well done one.
You have your dose of comedy and gore and drama, all knitted perfectly. 
The characters are colorful and you get your bit of social critic too, if you are paying enough attention. 
The only thing that I wouldn't like about this are actually two things, and are the most common flaws of anime: the filling scenes that add nothing to the story nor the characters or even the comedy or enjoyment of the show AND how the 'ending' was done. 
At this rate I am very well aware of which kind of matches Iam playing with, so I already know that finding a satisfying ending in anime is like finding the frigging holy grail. Some said that somebody has found it, but nobody no longer knows where it is hidden.

Alright so the story is somewhat original but the main focus are the characters. Sunako (main character) is probably one of the most unique female characters of all time. She makes the story absolutely hilarious and I kept craving for more.  The characters each have very distinct personas, that I believe many have grown attached to. It may even teach a lesson here and there which we can appreciate.Most people will give this anime a poor rating solely due to the artwork and that's upsetting. Sure the male cast has some feminine characteristics but once you get over that the anime is very enjoyable. I definitely recommend.\n\n

Kyouhei, Ranmaru, Takenaga, and Yukinojo are four gorgeous guys who make girls swoon without even trying.  Alas, they are not immune from financial woes and are in danger of being kicked out of their benefactress's mansion unless they do her one favor: teach her niece, Sunako, to be a lady.  This isn't as easy as it sounds, because Sunako is a slovenly shut-in with macabre interests and no desire to change.  Her best friend is an anatomical model named Hiroshi, and she can't get close to a good-looking boy without getting nosebleeds and fainting.  The boys aren't sure how to cohabitatewith her, much less give her a makeover.  Directed by "Excel Saga's" Nabeshin, the bulk of the show is pure situation comedy, charting the uneasy friendship that develops between Sunako and the boys, particularly their prickly leader Kyouhei.  And it also makes a few well-intentioned, but toothless attempts at commenting on the nature and perceptions of feminine beauty.\n\n
The show's visuals are very strange.  The boys are supposed to be super-attractive, but are drawn in a garish style that makes them look anything but.  For the purposes of the comedy and easier animation, the action will often switch to super-deformed character designs, so simplified they're practically stick figures.  Fortunately, the cheap visuals don't impact the shows strange but undeniable charms, and the series is at its best when it's at its most surreal.  The characters turn out to be genuinely likable and the show's message is a good one: beauty is all about self-confidence and self-esteem, so you can't change for anyone but yourself.

My love for this anime knows no bounds. After watching Ouran High School Host Club, I worried that I would never find another anime as attractive, sweet, and downright hilarious with such a special protagonist again. Well, I found it. Although I'm a sucker for the reverse-harem situation, what really makes this anime are the characters, especially Sunako Nakahara and Kyouhei Takano.
Although the four boys here are very good-looking, this anime makes that into a plot device, showing that being attractive can be as much of a curse as a blessing. Kyouhei's constantly being kidnapped, stalked, mobbed, and sexually harassed, to the point where heneeds a police escort and dreads Valentine's Day.


But the best part is that this anime is that it's utterly hysterical, and if you can finish it without having "Goth Goth! Loli Loli!" stuck in your head, you're not enjoying yourself enough.


Now, do beware that it's very strangely racist and...kind of ambiguous about being sexist or not. On one hand, the message is great, but on the other hand, girls do all the cooking and housework, and seem to enjoy it, because boys are hopeless at it. So I wasn't sure how to feel about that, though it only hindered my enjoyment a bit. To be fair, what anime isn't sexist or racist? Definitely check it out, especially if you're as enamored of Ouran as I was.

Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge is one of my favorites, and I'm sure if you watch it it will be one of yours too.
Story 9/10.
Living together with 4 beautiful boys in a big mansion? What could make a better story line, add the anti-social gloom and doom loving girl. Plus the goal to make her into a perfect lady when she obviously is hardheaded about staying in the darkness. And it gives you a perfect comedy.   
But what makes this story line unique is not that there are 4 pretty boys trying to make this girl beautiful, but the fact that it's notthe kind of thing where the girl realizes she's in love with the boy and they end up together all lovey dovey. Even though I wish there were more romantic parts I'm glad they didn't put to much into it. (If you are looking for it the manga has alot of perfect scenes that got cut out) The romance in this comedy is more subtle, but still heart warming in a funny way.


I have to knock off one point, because there were the Goth Loli sisters and I think they gave them more time then needed.


But basically, I'm saying that the story is halarious and one of a kind.


Art 9/10


Okay, I don't really know why people say that they aren't to fond of the art. Personally, I think it's refreshing and some how diffrent. But I have to knock off to points because of Sunako. She is basically in chibi form through the whole season. It really kind of ruined it, because the other characters would bend down to talk to her which made it hard to see her as a full grown character and not a kid. So, they could have drawn her in normal form more. But other than that I really did like the art.


I also loved the beginging, the art with the music made one of the best openings I've seen.


Sound. 8/10.


If you asked me before reading the manga I would have gave it a 9. But after reading the manga. The voices sounded really, annoying? Sanako sounded creepy, but that's supposed to be her personality. She just over emphasised the voice though. And Kyohei sounded a bit off after the manga. Haroshi bothered me the most... But I loved Yuki's voice. ^.^


I'm giving it an 8 instead of a 6 because of the music. I loved the beginging song and other songs used. 


Characters 10/10


Each character contributed to the halarity of the show. The badass, the sexy smart guy, the cutie, and the womenizer. With sunako all under one roof was a perfect blend for comedy. 


Enjoyment. 10/10


It had me laughing most of the time and I couldn't stop watching it.


Overall 9/10


I'd love to give it 10/10. But even if it was my favorite I have to give it a 9 because of the little things that bothered me. I suggest you watch this, and if you like it. I do sugguest the manga, which has it's faults but its so much fun to read.

To be quite honest, when I first came across Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge (YNSH in following text), I never had a slightest intention of viewing it. It may be that I don't have a thing for reverse harem stories, but, nevertheless, I didn't really think about it.
Still, while reading some recommendations, people said they had a blast of laughter throughout with a dash of romance so I decided to pick it up. I kind of regret it, but, at the same time, I kind of am not. 
To be honest, story is tragically bad, at least in my opinion. It never actually moves anywhere untilthe last 2 minutes of last episode, so it's kind of an annoying segment of anime. It's basically about four beautiful (...) guys trying to convert an ugly girl into a lady. The story does seem kind of ... stupid, but it had potential. The first couple of episodes were actually quite good, possibly leading to something great, but, in the end, it never really gotten anywhere. If you want to go into this anime for its amazing storytelling, don't. We do get bits and pieces of the background story from two characters, but overall, not much.


Aside from the story, YNSH has a lot of humor. For the first half of anime, I was laughing my ass off; still, in its latter half, the jokes became old and repetitive. Constant nosebleeds, kidnappings and dazzling quickly grew old and plain and it barely got me to finish the series, hoping for a satisfying ending (nothing there though).


Art ... art is annoying, to be honest. Even after watching all 25 episodes, I still couldn't bring myself to accept those freekin' lips on the guys. They just seem out of place (REALLY OUT OF PLACE) and quite ... freaky to be frank. Also, the fact that Sunako spends 80% of the anime in her chibi form doesn't really bode well with me. Still, her scary faces and whatnot were quite well done - I was actually impressed. However, most of the time, backgrounds are plain and uninteresting with little to no imagination put into them. As I said, I couldn't get used to the art even after finishing anime. Sure, there are some pretty girls here and there, but since the main focus are guys, it's quite unbearable to stare at them for longer than 2 seconds because you want to puke. 


While we are at the character department, I also have some complaints. The characters lack ... any kind of development - I mean ANY KIND. The way you see the characters in episode one is the exact one you'll see in episode 25 - even our beloved Sunako, to whom this "transformation" is directed. We have bookworm, playboy, "cutie" boy, loud and annoying mouth-worm, annoying but lady-like aunt, goth-loli (don't ask), cute but love-struck girl, scary, ugly and overall plain girl and ... oh, it's enough. First of, if you're looking for the characters you can relate to, move on. It's impossible. Either they're super-uber-dazzling or they're just plain ugly. Of course, this servers quite well for some comedic moments, but ... it gets annoying after awhile. Even Takano, the only character that gets more than two lines of his past, is impossible to relate to since his "sad past" is derivative of utterly impossible circumstances. 


If I say that I enjoyed this anime throughout, I'd be lying. Sure, I had my share of laughs of course, but a lot of times I was just withering in agony, waiting for SOMETHING to happen. If you're into massive, impossible and CONSTANT nosebleeds, sparkling men and ugly goth-loli girls, you will have a kick out of this series. I swear, it's impossible to count the number of nosebleeds in this anime. And they're not the simple ones; just the ones that can manifest the pool of blood. 


Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge is not a bad anime, don't get me wrong. However, the bits and pieces that are fun, original and hilarious are often overshadowed by its ridiculous setting, situations out of this world which are impossible to relate to, characters that are definitely not human and non-existent story. Still, it's worth the watch if you have nothing else major to complete.

I liked this series very much. Main character reminds me of myself!

Music is really great! I love japanese rock x]
Characters are very original.
About the storyline: every character is unique. With time we get known each personality. Nothing is as it seems!

I'm not going to lie and make this seem like it's the most original anime out there but there truly is something about this anime that makes you go back for a re-watch. The sexual innuendos mixed with the comedic scenarios and well balanced characters makes this anime extremely enjoyable.

I don't think that I have any negatives for this anime, but I really wishSunako has more chemistry with the characters and I wish it had alot of romance in it (because i'm so into romcom anime XD). I also wish for a season 2, ik it's too late for one, but I still need one ukjefnihwkejbfnekj!

What can one say about this anime?
Well i can say that i really like the main goal of the serie.That a group of 4 "handsome" guys are given the task to turn a hidden unkept woman into a real lady.
But the story drops that really fast as the guys seem to give up trying after a couple eps and usually just accept her odd behavior. Its heartwarming that they do but the main goal was to turn her into a lady.
The anime starts to overuse chibis after a few episodes and thats a bloody shame cause they girl in question is very pretty and itwould be more fun to see her panic in normal human form.

Instead we get to see her mostly as a chibi beeing treated like a 5 year old buy the guys.

The guys are drawn very feminine and it can be offputting to many, including me.

Also overuse of nosebleed..cmon, after a week or two she would start getting used to them.

But the humor and my wanting to see Sunako and Kyouhei get togheter held me watching.


In the end i will give the anime a 6 cause while the style and chibis was offputting i enjoyed the characters, the humor and kept wishing for the two to get togheter.


All i can say is: Be patient with the anime and you will start to enjoy it.

Okay,  I though that I would try this anime because Vic is one of my favourite voice actors, but I started it, I have nothing against the plot line or the characters, I just can't stand the drawing of the characters, I might try to pick it back up and look past the bad drawing. I feel like I would get hate for this, but I am very picky about what animesI watch, and if they don't have at least drawing that is sort of good, I probably won't watch it.\n\n
I dont know very much of anything about the anime itself, if other people like it thats fine, I won't hate on you for liking it, I don't really care but if you are picky about the drawing in animes like I am, you might be able to tolerate the animation in this, but I can't. Like I said, I might actually pick this anime back up, although I can't be sure.

An excellent reverse-harem comedy series with a nice gothic twist.
PLOT: Rarely does a show make such a strong impression with its 1st few episodes than Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge does. I laughed till I cried during the 1st episode – think I watched it a few times and then made my sister watch it too.  The show has very strong beginning and end, but the middle is a bit flabby – these are mostly anime original episodes, but even the middle episodes are still entertaining. The humour is OTT with lots of slapstick and visual gags, which get recycled quite a bit but stillremain funny. There is also a fair bit of character development for the main characters, particularly Sunako & Kyohei throughout the series, but mainly it’s about the lulz.


ANIMATION: The art style takes a while to get used to – the character designs are not standard bishie fare, they look slightly odd and effeminate with their massive pouty lips, but once you get past that its fine – after all its really the reactions of the other characters to the bishies ‘dazzling good looks’ that makes the comedy work.  Sunako herself is very pretty when she’s in lady/kickass mode, but for the majority of the time she’s drawn as a chibi. All the characters are prone to revert to chibi form at the drop of a hat – it is a bit overused, but normally only heightens the impact of the humour.  Spontaneous showers of rose petals, sparkles & nosebleeds are also normal in Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge to the extent that it’s a parody of overused shoujo conventions.


MUSIC & VOICE ACTING: I remember that the soundtrack was very rock orientated with great OP & EDs and I also loved the voice cast to bits.  Sunako stands out for me as well due to her dramatic mood swings.


Overall a fun comedy series – recommended if you just want to have a good laugh.

When I first found this show, I thought to myself: "It sounds just like Ouran!" And proceeded to watch about 10 episodes that day.  Now, however, I'm finding it difficult to finish it and here's why:
Story: 7/10
It's similar to shoujo anime's like Ourah High School Host Club in that there's one girl surrounded by gorgeous men and doesn't seem to appreciate it.  This story is a bit different in the fact that the men have to change her from a horror movie loving loner to a lady or they are forced to pay the rent.  It definitely has humor and romance, whichis what most people look for in shoujo's to begin with.  The reason it's only good is because I think that the story never went any further than that.  They keep trying to turn her into a proper lady and each episode (so far) is completely stand alone.  (Keep in mind that I'm still trying to finish it and therefore this review could change if I find out that the story ever developed into something more interesting.  In fact, one of the reasons I'm struggling is because the story is so stale right now.)


Art: 3/10

Where do I begin?  As everyone has mentioned in all the reviews of this anime that I've read: the art sucks.  It's not just that the guys look like girls; it's that all the main characters look the same.  If you were to have all the "dazzling creatures" in this series and take away their hair and draw them in black and white; they would be the same character!  There is no telling the difference at all!  You can draw beautiful characters and still be able to tell who they are and what gender they are without their hair; Vampire Knight (my favorite art-not story- as far as anime and manga go) is proof of that.  Another complaint I have about the art is that the characters all are drawn poorly.  I don't mean the chibi characters, or the Goth Loli sisters (though those are also awful) I mean the eyes of the characters.  They are too wide and too large on the face.  Basically it would be as if I were to draw a face shape and fill it with only large eyes and large lips.  I know it sounds harsh, but that's what I think.  Why didn't I give the art a lower score then?  Because the frustrating thing is that there are good moments in it!  When Sunako is drawn at her full height and given the same art as those around her, the style of everyone improves.  The eyes become slightly smaller and the lips a little less full.  There are also more details in those small moments.  But I think you get the idea; I'll stop ranting now.


Sound: 8/10

The music was the sole saver of this show; the only reason I still want to finish the anime at all.  No, I am not talking about the opening and closing songs; I disliked those as well.  I'm talking about the soundtrack itself.  It was written by the same composers behind Jigoku Shoujo (Hellgirl), Yasuharu Takanashi and Hiromi Mizutani, and those two work amazingly well together.  Sadly I can't find some of the themes from this anime that I enjoyed, since the J-drama's soundtrack seems to have all the attention.


Character: 6/10

Well, back to the bad I suppose.   The male characters all had interesting back stories, in a way.  The same could not be said of the females, especially Sunako.  The fact that she became a depressed antisocial lunatic because one guy called her ugly is stupid.  Yes, words can hurt and guys are stupid, but after a few weeks you get over it and move on.  Every other girl, however, seemed to have no deeper motive than having one of the beautiful men fall in love with her, no matter what.  Characters like that embarrass all females.  But both the male and female characters, whether they had interesting back stories or not, did not develop in the 15 episodes that I've made it through so far.  Not a single step forward has been made by anyone aside from Kyohei, who is simply developing a crush on Sunako, for more than half of the show.  In other words, unless the show makes a drastic change in the last 10 episodes, the characters will have been bland, flat, and similar to each other all the way to the end.


Enjoyment: 4/10

Sorry, but this anime isn't that enjoyable, aside from the music and the humor.


Overall: 5/10

I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for something that requires minimum thought to watch.


In closing, this review may seem mean, but frankly, this anime isn't worth it aside from the music.  From what I've read in reviews, the J-drama is much better, so if it's the story that interests you; I would check that out instead.

This was an interesting show, to say the least. Upon watching even the first few episodes I was making connections between it and other shojo that I'd seen before. However "Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge" or "The Wallflower" as I will call it in this review, strikes me as completely satirical. It takes the elements of a traditional shojo and then just goes insane with it, over exaggerating the usual arch types and making them so loud and in your face that its hard not to feel a little dizzy just watching them. Its a fantastic sort of journey, which tries to take you outside thebounds of the general stereotypes, which is ultimately both refreshing and eyebrow-raising. 


Here's the plot. To summarize, there are four so called 'extremely attractive' young males living together in a giant mansion for some non apparent reason. When you first see this, the more well versed anime viewer might sigh and shake their head. But most of us already have some idea what we're in for. This isn't exactly the show you come to watch for some kind of deep philosophical thought here. 

Anyway, these guys have to pay rent to their eccentric land lady, and its quite the chore for them to do so. She offers them a deal. They have to turn her niece, Sunako, into a real lady. If they do so, their rent will be free. If they fail, she'll triple it. Or something like that. Naturally, they think they can handle it. But then they all do, don't they? 

Enter Sunako Nakahara. This chick is one seriously messed up kid, but that's what we like about her. Shes our emotionally damaged, twisted "The Grudge" inspired heroine. Partial to fawning over medical dummies, skeletons, slasher movies and the various other things infesting our nightmares, she is the one these four glamorous guys have to turn into a lady. Just how, HOW will they do it?


The plot isn't exactly what I would call a masterpiece but it is intriguing. You stumble into this mishmash of dazzling boys and roses and mansions and sparkles, and counter it with the dark and grotesque. Am I really watching a shojo? Well its more of a comedy. The presentation is a bit muddled. There's a lot of screaming, flailing and running around aimlessly. This aspect of The Wallflower gets a little more tolerable later, but I can't tell if that's really the show or if I just got used to it. Most of it seems to consist of filler, but I'm also pretty sure that's just the way it was written. It has a lot of "wtf" moments which range from both humorous to just stupid. There are also a number of characters with absolutely no point than to play on stereotypes and be annoying. And speaking of annoying, the way the anime dances on particular gender rolls can almost verge on insulting for both the male and female characters. Its not like they're meant to be taken seriously, but its noteworthy. 

The character Kyohei, for instance, who plays as the prominent love interest, all his problems stem from the fact that he is simply too beautiful for existence. Swarms, and I mean literal hordes of females, each with the same face and different hair, (As per usual animation laziness) rush to him at almost every waking moment. This happens with the other main guy characters, but its mostly Kyohei who receives the attention. In fact, every one of his problems in his life revolve around the fact hes so bloody pretty.

Which leads me to the point that the show primarily revolves around appearances. The morals that it tries to teach us aren't exactly deep but they're still good values that really come through toward the end of the series. The Wallflower questions what it really means to be a lady, and to define what is attractive, something that's refreshing in an anime, I think.


While I'm on that note, the overall visuals of the show can be hard to get used to. The main male characters look interesting, although their feminine lips and eyelashes were a bit disturbing at first. The female characters have little range in style and are all pretty much the same in character design aside from hair and eye color. The animation itself was nothing special and there was plenty of lazy stick figure drawings and chibi's to take up space in the hopes that they'd act to convey the humorous situations better. There was really nothing at all to say wow about, but there was nothing incredibly wrong with it either. It was effective but lackluster at best. 


There's little to say about the music, as they only had one opening theme and two ending themes, all of which were nothing special. Though the second ending theme was catchy, I'll admit. Sound effects were standard. I had to watch the dub, as I wasn't able to find a Japanese version which I would have preferred to watch, but the English voice acting grows on you after you listen for awhile. At first it bothered me in such a way that it wasn't so much bad as there was one or two elements of the voice casting which were glaringly out of place.It kind of wears on you, giving you a feeling like you have a headache but you don't at the same time. After 25 episodes you kind of get used to it.


In any case, The Wallflower is an anime which is entertaining, and will appeal to shojo fans who like to laugh. It has most of the classic shojo episodes, including the mandatory trip to a hot spring and a school festival thing, each of which carrying a small twist that we usually don't expect. The characters aren't deep, but each carry one exaggerated element that doesn't make them unique but at least makes them funny. If you like the art style then there are plenty of bishounen/beshojo moments to swoon over, as well. I could go on, but I don't want to spoil it. For fans of Ouran High School Host Club, this is probably your kind of show, and even for you more curious folk who've simply wandered over to The Wallflower, reading this with vague interest, I'd recommend giving it a try.

The story is actually interesting and has a unique feel to it. I absolutely love the varying degrees of humor that it displays. It has everything from lighthearted to a bit of self-depreciating humor, which keeps the plot moving and allows episodes to be exciting. Some of the episode plots can seem to be sort of an old hat to people who have watched similar series, but it didn't stop my enjoyment of the anime in the least. In fact, it kind of made the series even more exciting because I got to see the characters try to get out of the situation in anew and interesting ways. The voice acting was superb, whether you watched it in the English sub or dub. I actually enjoyed it so much that I had to watch it in both. There was only one thing that I disliked in the anime and it was the characters: sometimes the characters fell into distinct troupes, which would detract from the anime's appeal. However, this was toward the beginning of the anime and actually became less frequent as the series progressed. The anime also didn't have a lot of romance to it. However, it is so entertaining that I really didn't notice it until I sat down to write this review (It was that enjoyable).  Definitely, recommend it, if you want a funny anime that has a bit of a slice of life feel to it.

I really loved this anime for it's characters and overall story line. I was let down a little with the lack of any romantic development but it did not ruin the enjoyment of the show. The art style is one that I tend to like but I know that some people don't prefer it. It wasn't really a reverse harem even tho it was listed as one.  
The main character is very interesting but i found that by the end I was getting a bit tired of the lack of development from her. Yes there was slight changes but nothing to be excited about.
Theromantic story line was perfectly set up but then fell extremely flat. They could have made this into a very amazing love story if they had put the effort in. I know it was more of a comedy but it really left me wanting more out of it.\n\n
The secondary characters are simply amazing. They honestly make the show as good as it is. The comedy is silly and fun which helps take the edge off the lack of romance.

Call me superficial, but I could not stand the art. It's probably one of the ugliest (if not the ugliest) anime I've ever seen. At times, it was comical and at others it wasn't. Also, I didn't see the story going anywhere, really. I was expecting it to be something I could get into, considering that it was recommended for most of the shows I watched and loved, by this website and others. I couldn't find really any reasons  to enjoy this show, no matter how I looked at it. 
I realize that these may just be me, but I really wouldn't recommend thisshow to anyone. I don't know how it's constantly grouped with shows like LoveCom.

I really like this anime. I've watched it three times I also read the manga because of my desperation on the ending. The story is outrageous. Love this animel Ive rewatched it multiple times now and I can honestly say that it's one of my favorites.
The anime starts out very quickly and then the story moves a little slowly for my taste, particularly considering that its 25 episodes!! That said, Its an exciting transformation story that nevers fails to be interesting to follow.  I will say however that theres a lot of random crap that happens that is not vital to the story and doesnt even make very much sense. 
The art would get a lot higher of a rating if the main characters, who are boys, didnt look likelesbian women.\n
The sound is so-so, but the music is pretty without being sappy.\n
The characters are fantastic, despite not nessasarily being developed thoroughly.  I think that the main chracters being sort of typical is making fun of the stereotypes we see in anime guys, and they are vital to the story.\n
Overall, this is definitley an interesting anime, and its full of surprises.

I love funny anime.  YNSH is a very light anime that has a plot which is not at all complicated.  It's good if you want something pretty cheesy and mindless to watch after a long day. Unfortunately, it wasn't as funny as I hoped, and the humor that was there was not at all witty and in fact pretty lame sometimes.
Story: very simple plot, only a microscopic bit of romance.  The premise makes you expect that at every given chance, the four boys will be trying to force Sunako to become a lady, but they don't really try that much.  Ina way this was good because the subliminal message is accepting people for who they are and liking people because of how they treat you, even if some of their hobbies are "scary" or "weird" or even if they are supernaturally good-looking.


Art: All the characters spend a good amount of time as featureless chibis.  When the characters were in non-chibi form, I thought the art was pretty bland, and I didn't like the male character designs.  They were all angles, plump lips, girly faces, and not at all manly.  Some anime characters can legit make me swoon. These men looked too girly 99% of the time, and I was totally turned off to them 5 minutes into the first episode.


Sound: I liked the opening and closing songs (the 2nd closing song better than the first).  I actually really like the BGM. There are little themes in the BGM that play during certain moods or types of scenes and I thought it gave the series some continuity.  It's also kind of fun sometimes when you hear a certain little jingle and you can think "Oh, Sunako is going to go crazy in a second" or "yup, the boys are going to start dazzling any moment", and then you are right. 


Character: The development is a bit more subtle than in some animes, which I didn't mind.  Sunako definitely grows more than any of the other characters.  The male characters are typical male anime tropes: "cute and girly" pretty boy, tall-dark-and-stoic, player/lover-boy, and hunky bad-boy.  It was interesting to see how they all felt differently about their looks.  In some reverse-harem animes, the bishies all know it and they love it, so it was refreshing to see that sometimes their good looks even caused some problems!  It was also nice to see how very different personalities got along, and neat to see how they had to learn to respect each other's feelings and boundaries.


Enjoyment: after a long day of college classes and work, when I'm feeling pretty brain-dead and blah, this was ok to relax with and got me laughing a few times.

I don't usually write reviews for animes but I just really have to write one for this. 
I have already watched this when I was in middle school. I was 9 or 10 back then, and every time I look back to the memory of watching this anime, I really smile because the memory I have about this series is so good. I remember going straight home after school just to watch every episode of this anime. Yamato Nadeshiko Sichi Henge never failed to make my cousins and I laugh every time we watched it. I still remember that I was the one who enjoyedit so much because my personality and attitude is much closer to Sunako than my other cousins, but although they didn't find themselves in the character of Sunako, they enjoyed the series just as much! 


2013, when I began watching anime series again, I thought of rewatching Yamato Nadeshiko because it brings so much good memories, but then I thought that my standard in anime especially the way it is drawn and animated has increased. I thought that maybe my taste in anime has changed since most of the animes I watched were all modern, and the appearance of the characters has changed. I thought I would not enjoy it as much as I did before, and forcing myself to watch it while momentarily comparing it to the modern animes would ruin my memory of it. But I was wrong. It all changed when I began rewatching it.


2016, my classmate gave me a copy of the whole episodes of Yamato Nadeshiko, and she told me she has re watched it and enjoyed it so much. After watching Ao Haru Ride,, I decided to finally rewatch Yamato Nadeshiko. AND LORD ALMIGHTY, I REALIZED THAT NO MATTER HOW "OLD" YOU MAY THINK IT IS, IT IS STILL FAR BETTER THAN THE MODERN ANIMES. LIKE GOD, I WAS SO WRONG WHEN I SAID THAT COMPARING IT TO MODERN ANIMES WOULD RUIN MY MEMORY OF IT. IT DID NOT! In fact, I began loving Yamato Nadeshiko even more! Most of the modern animes I've watched are stark, and have many "silences". Silence is what I call those scenes and parts that are quite awkward and are kind of boring/uninteresting/unnecessary/irrelevant. But in Yamato Nadeshiko, there are no silences! The way it is dubbed in Japanese is soooo freaking amazing! I like the way the characters yell HAHA I always wonder how they recorded that. EVERY EPISODE IS HILARIOUS! Although it is a Shōjo anime, everyone would really enjoy it! Adult or not, it would really make you laugh! The music that they used in the scenes are also appropriate and I could tell that they were deliberately selected haha Also paired with the scenes in the anime, they are really funny! The way it was animated and drawn is also amazing! I always think if the animator/artist ever got tired of drawing/animating them! This is really a UNIQUE, FUNNY, and AMAZING anime! 


I remember my teacher telling me that what makes a great film is the things that it leaves its viewers. And I tell you what, when I rewatched this, I frequently smile because even though it has been around 8-9 years ago, I still remember most of the episodes, as well as the values it taught me. :)

Im going to start off with the flaws in this anime. First off im definitely with everyone one else in saying that the art is terrible! I have seen worse, for example shin chan....but obviously they did it to be funny. To me the artist made me feel that maybe they thought beauty for them was in the lips and eyes. Doing so made the men look girly and throwing the main characters into chibi form all the time upset me and makes me think it wasn't out of comedy, but purely laziness! The way they have drawn the characters gives a lower rating tothe show, or in cases like me shut the show off all together. 

In the good side of this anime I did find myself laughing alot and fell in love with the main characters, not only did I find the main female lead intriguing but she was perfect and the complete oposite of what you would figure her to be. They did use alot of the same plot I saw in ouran host club but for me thats what made it work. My person opinion is that they could have used more romance for the two to keep veiwers on edge and satisfied in the end. 


Out of all the animes ive seen, I have got to say this one is a bit odd for a comedy, but in a good way and im glad i did not shut it off. I would recomend this anime to every one needing a good laugh ^_^

I must say; this was conglomeration of happy for the retina! I started this anime because of the reverse-harem male character art  - and to my utmost pleasure; it did satiate my expections.

Story

It took some time adjusting to this art with its obsession with bi-shounen features - however after the first episode or so I began to really enjoy watching the character art.

Story:10 The plot of the story is great,you have a girl who isn't  particular a beauty,who lacks social skills and is obsessed with horror movies and things a normal girl would try to avoid at any cost,4 really handsome boys,one big mansion which rent is really high and a energetic aunt who only desires 1 thing and that is to turn her niece in a proper lady which is basically the most impossible thing on the earth!What do you get if you add them all together!Yes,you've guessed right!You get one heck of a story called YAMATO NADESHIKO SHICHI HENGE!!!!!
Art:9 I've noticed that most ofthe people who have watched this anime said that the art was bad and could have been better,but I personally loved the art and wouldn't want it to be any different.But this is only my opinion!!


Sound:9 The sound was great especially the background sound,it matched the anime perfectly!The images of the OP song were not that original which I think was an issue due the popularity of the series!but from ep 14 and on it got original images.I personally loved the 2nd ED song.It got a great beat and is so funny .


Character:10 The characters in this series are some of my favorite anime characters.There isn't one character that you won't love.How can you especially not LOVE Sunako and Kyouhei.They're so damn funny!!


Enjoyment:10 I've never enjoyed a shoujo anime as much as I did this anime.This anime kept me entertaining from the beginning till the end.There wasn't an episode where I didn't laugh till my belly hurt.I was really sad when I finished watching this anime,but  as the manga goes on I really hope from the bottom of my heart that we will get another ass kicking season!!


Overall:10 I think that everyone should give this anime a shot.I think that everyone can enjoy it.If you love a good comedy,you  should definitely  watch this anime.

So give this anime a try and you certainly won't be disappointed that you've watched it,I know I wasn't!!!!:)

This is like one of those 1980s sitcoms, but in a good way! First, the writer establishes a cheesy but lovable premise. In this case, there are four gorgeous guys (who should all be supermodels) staying in a lavish mansion. Their landlady tells them she's leaving them in charge, and that they can have free rent if they agree to take her niece under their wings and teach this girl how to be "a real lady." Now for the sitcom kicker: The niece (Sakura) is a horror maniac and a shut-in who hates people (especially beautiful people!) and looks a lot like the ghost fromThe Ring. 


The cartoon graphics are chaotic and all over the place, switching from fancy bishoujo images to chibi and even to stick figures in some instances! The best part of the sound, in my opinion, is the ending sequence song "Carnation" by Kiyoharu; coupled with a cute animation of Hishori/A-tai (the lead character's medical mannequin) dancing to the music. 


I absolutely loved Sakura's character and that, even though she was picked on for what she liked, she never changed to fit other people's expectations of her. There is even a little love interest between her and the strongest male in the group, Kyouhei, although their relationship never gets very far.

Yamato Nadeshiko Shichi Henge was actually better than I thought it would be. If you liked Ouran highschool host club then you will probably really enjoy this anime. 
       It relates to girls who have been bullied for their appearance and the affects it can have on someone. It's amazing how one name can change a girl forever. okay okay, this anime isn't all blah blah blah lovely lovey girly issues. It's actually much more than that. more comedy than anything. ( the manga has more, but overall I was rather pleased with this anime)I know the art is a little frustrating, but If you're willing to look past the strange art than you're in for a great anime. I think the anime is drawn like this to capture sunako's true beauty.

If you’re looking for an anime which is purely comedy, this could be the one for you. Perfect Girl Evolution is about a girl who enjoys the darkness and is psychologically allergic to beautiful people. Unfortunately for her, she is to stay in a mansion with four bishounen. 
The core idea of the story lies in turning Sunako-chan into a perfect lady and (perhaps, through) developing love between her and one of the guys. But the anime, being heavily comedic, digressed much from the main idea. 
Nonetheless, it is highly enjoyable for those who simply fancy comedy despite its ridiculousness. A light anime with highrewatch value as it is hilarious. There’s not much to be appreciated about the art, though, seeing that it is rather rigid and the supposedly good-looking guys really look like girls.
